oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DESIGN OF A FLOATING PLATFORM FOR AN INNOVATIVE DUCTED WIND TURBINE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gurnari, Luana
Filianoti, Pasquale
Capua, Claudio De
Alizzio, Damiano
Scordamaglia, Valerio
Ruffa, Filippo
Fulco, Gaetano
Lugarà, Maria Carla
Camporeale, Sergio Mario
Torresi, Marco
Bari, Politecnico di
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper analyses the dynamics loads exerted by waves on a floating offshore platform in the Straits of Messina, (South of Italy), hosting an innovative ducted wind turbine. The force exerted by largest sea waves occurring during lifetime on the floating platform are predicted by the quasi-determinism theory, which foresees what happens if a group of waves of exceptionally large height occurs at a given point in the sea.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 37 (2022): Proceedings of 37th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 2022; structures.91
